Google.eligibility: Bachelor degree (BTech, MCA, BCA); Diploma holders/BA cannot apply

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Permanent role (PPO) chances are 99% after internship
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Focus on fundamentals and thinking structure

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Build foundation in DSA (Arrays, Strings, Linked List, Stacks, Queues, Graphs)
preparation_strategy.strategy-2: Solve 50-60 problems on Leetcode or GeeksforGeeks in January
preparation_strategy.strategy-3: Build one simple full stack project

Google-2.timeline: Applications open September 17; runs through January 2026

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Based on Glassdoor and employee data

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Not mentioned

Google-3.hire: Open source problem solving competition; organization selection followed by proposal submission
Google-3.eligibility: All engineering branches; at least 18 years old
Google-3.timeline: January to March (Organization selection in February; applications open in March)

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Tag of GSOC in resume is very important for recruiters
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Start contributing to organizations in Jan/Feb before applications open

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Start contributing to open source organizations early

Google-4.eligibility: Second year students; mostly for girls

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: If you perform well, you get a PPI in third year
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Resume should be ATS friendly with top-notch projects

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Top-notch DSA is required

Microsoft.eligibility: First year and second year undergraduates in Computer Science (BTech, BSc, BCA); Not open for MCA
Microsoft.timeline: Opens around November; check between May and July

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Designed as a pipeline program with strong long-term conversion

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Not mentioned

Microsoft-2.eligibility: Bachelor or Master degree in CS or related IT field; must have at least one semester remaining after internship
Microsoft-2.timeline: Applications already open (Current as of Jan 2026)

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Requires strong knowledge of algorithms and DSA
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Must be able to solve Leetcode problems

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Prepare good projects and strong DSA foundation

Microsoft-3.eligibility: Second year and third year students

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Opportunity to get PPIs for full-time roles

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Not mentioned

Amazon.hire: Direct application on Amazon.jobs or rolling basis
Amazon.timeline: March to May (8 to 12 weeks duration)

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: High-performing interns often get PPO
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Covers relocation and housing expenses

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Not mentioned

Amazon-2.eligibility: First to third year female students only

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Higher selection chances for female candidates
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Typically happens once a year

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Not mentioned

Amazon-3.eligibility: BTech/MTech students with basic Python and Machine Learning knowledge

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Often leads to direct Amazon interview calls
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Focuses on real world problems in ML

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Acquire basic knowledge of Python and Machine Learning

Uber.hire: Hackathon based competition; top 3 teams get rewards
Uber.eligibility: Engineering students; third year or final year

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Top teams get cash prizes worth 5 lakh
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: High return on investment (ROI) compared to other programs

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Focus on good problem solving skills and DSA

Uber-2.eligibility: Female candidates only; second year students
Uber-2.timeline: November to December / January to February

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Specifically for second year female students

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Not mentioned

Flipkart.hire: Four round process: Quiz, coding assessment, case study based coding, National Finals

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: India's largest engineering campus challenge
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Can now participate solo (new change for 2026)

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Prepare for quiz and coding assessment rounds

Flipkart-2.eligibility: Second year female students (expected to graduate in 2027)
Flipkart-2.timeline: February to April (8 to 10 week duration)

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Top 500 get access to interview skills workshops and networking events
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: PPO package can reach 28-32 LPA

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Not mentioned

Flipkart-3.hire: Coding challenge followed by mentorship and PPI
Flipkart-3.eligibility: Women in 3rd/4th year BTech or 1st/2nd year MTech

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Top 30 performers get all-expense paid trip to Bangalore headquarters
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Full-time package around 32 lakhs per year

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Check application details on unstop.com

Goldman Sachs.hire: Competitive coding contest on platforms like Hacker Rank
Goldman Sachs.eligibility: Bachelor or Master degree students (Final and Pre-final year); Accepts all engineering branches and MCA/BCA

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Very competitive with low conversion rates
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: PPO package around 25 to 30 LPA

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Master fast problem solving on Leetcode (Bi-weekly/Weekly contests)

American Express.eligibility: Technical degree students (CSE, IT, ECE); female students in 3rd/Final year (sometimes 1st/2nd year)

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Offers chance to secure PPO after internship

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Form a team and participate in the hackathon challenge

LinkedIn.hire: Mentorship program by LinkedIn engineers; includes a hackathon
LinkedIn.eligibility: Second year female students in BTech/BE
LinkedIn.timeline: January to February (Currently open as of Jan 2026)

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Provides mentorship and PPI/PPO opportunities
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Mentors are actual engineers from LinkedIn

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Not mentioned

EY.hire: Annual tech competition/hackathon based on case studies
EY.eligibility: Second, third, or final year engineering students
EY.stipend/ctc: 40,000 stipend; winning price up to 3 lakh

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Focuses heavily on AI and Generative AI
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Full-time CTC can reach 10-13 LPA

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Focus on case study articulation and problem solving

JP Morgan.eligibility: Second or third year tech students (BTech/BE); 7 CGPA or 70% minimum requirement
JP Morgan.timeline: February to March / September to October

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Strong team work and programming skills required

Adobe.hire: Direct hiring based on DSA and development skills

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Adobe brand adds massive credibility to resume
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: PPO package can exceed 40 LPA

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Focus on strong DSA and development skills

Walmart-2.hire: Team-based hackathon where solutions are presented to judges
Walmart-2.eligibility: Open for all students in teams

Myntra.hire: Hackathon based; includes ideation phase and grand finale
Myntra.eligibility: Third year and final year students

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Purely skill-based screening with less focus on DSA
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Winners receive cash prizes (e.g., 3 lakh to 4.6 lakh)

preparation_strategy.strategy-1: Build a good project and present it well

PayPal.eligibility: Bachelor degree students passing out in 2027

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: Timeline based on previous year's opening

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: High PPO conversion rate if internship is secured

Juspay.hire: Programming rounds, deep programming, and hackathon style tests; includes ~7 interview rounds
Juspay.eligibility: Third year and final year students

Meta.stipend/ctc: Winning prizes up to 20,000 USD; internship stipend 1.5 to 2.5 lakh

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Tag of Meta is highly valuable for CV

Mercari.hire: Selection based on product thinking and coding ability
Mercari.eligibility: Any year of BTech graduates (including freshers)

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-1: One of the highest paying internships mentioned
key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Very low intake and low conversion rate

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Incredibly competitive

Oracle.hire: Direct application on career page; involves resume upload
Oracle.eligibility: Current students/Freshers (0 to 2 years experience); proficiency in English required

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Mentorship from industry experts provided

MLH Fellowship.timeline: Season wise: Winter, Spring, Summer, Fall
MLH Fellowship.stipend/ctc: Up to 2,000 USD depending on the batch

key_notes_how_to_prepare.tip-2: Apply if you know basic Git and GitHub

Summer of Bitcoin.hire: Proposal based; work on open-source blockchain for 3 months
Summer of Bitcoin.eligibility: All years of students; any technical course

RBI.eligibility: Any year student (Tech or Non-Tech); 3rd and 4th year preferred
